page.title: 15Captain John Smith
page.content: {John Smith } This man was born at Covell's Farm in Willoughby,christened in the local church and destined to become a famous Elizabethan adventurer.He went to school in Louth and then went to sea having many adventures before doing that for which he is most famous,the founding of the State of Virginia, first of the American colonies.The best-known story of Smith is how he was saved by an indian princess named Pocahontas whose father,chief Powhaton,ordered Smith's execution.The princess threw herself on Smith and pleaded for his life which was granted. John Smith is looked upon by the Americans as the founder of their country and there is a close assoc- iation between Willoughby and James- town, the capital of Virginia.{See p16
